name: Hytale Server
author: sanasol@sanasol.ws
description: Hytale game server with automatic download. No Hytale account required. Supports both F2P and official licensed clients. For official clients: admin runs /auth logout, /auth persistence Encrypted, /auth login device in server console.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Hytale F2P Server Installation Script
# Downloads pre-patched server from F2P host - no official auth required

echo "=== Hytale F2P Server Installation ==="
echo "Downloads server from F2P host (no official auth required)"
echo ""

# Install required packages
echo "Installing required packages..."
apt-get update
apt-get install -y unzip curl default-jdk

# Configuration
AUTH_DOMAIN="${AUTH_DOMAIN:-auth.sanasol.ws}"
F2P_DOWNLOAD_BASE="${F2P_DOWNLOAD_BASE:-https://download.sanasol.ws/download}"
ASM_VERSION="9.6"
PATCHER_URL="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sanasol/hytale-auth-server/master/patcher/DualAuthPatcher.java"
INJECTED_CLASS="com/hypixel/hytale/server/core/auth/DualAuthContext.class"

cd /mnt/server

# ========================================
# Step 0: Create start.sh early
# ========================================
echo ""
echo "=== Step 0: Creating start script ==="

cat > start.sh << 'STARTSCRIPT'
#!/bin/bash
# Hytale F2P Server Start Script
set -e

echo "=========================================="
echo "  Hytale F2P Server"
echo "=========================================="
echo ""
echo "DUAL AUTHENTICATION SUPPORTED:"
echo "  - F2P clients: Connect directly (no setup needed)"
echo "  - Official clients: Admin runs in SERVER CONSOLE:"
echo "      /auth logout"
echo "      /auth persistence Encrypted"
echo "      /auth login device"
echo "    Then complete Hytale auth (game license required)"
echo ""

# Configuration
AUTH_DOMAIN="${AUTH_DOMAIN:-auth.sanasol.ws}"
# Use Pterodactyl's SERVER_PORT if available, otherwise fall back to HYTALE_PORT
HYTALE_PORT="${SERVER_PORT:-${HYTALE_PORT:-5520}}"
MEMORY_OVERHEAD="${MEMORY_OVERHEAD:-256}"
AUTH_MODE="${AUTH_MODE:-authenticated}"
HYTALE_SERVER_NAME="${HYTALE_SERVER_NAME:-Hytale F2P Server}"
JVM_ARGS="${JVM_ARGS:-}"

# Calculate heap size from SERVER_MEMORY (Pterodactyl built-in)
SERVER_MEM=${SERVER_MEMORY:-0}
if [ "$SERVER_MEM" -le 0 ] 2>/dev/null || [ -z "$SERVER_MEM" ]; then
    # Detect available memory from system
    if [ -f /sys/fs/cgroup/memory.max ]; then
        CGROUP_MEM=$(cat /sys/fs/cgroup/memory.max 2>/dev/null)
        if [ "$CGROUP_MEM" != "max" ] && [ -n "$CGROUP_MEM" ]; then
            SERVER_MEM=$((CGROUP_MEM / 1024 / 1024))
        fi
    elif [ -f /sys/fs/cgroup/memory/memory.limit_in_bytes ]; then
        CGROUP_MEM=$(cat /sys/fs/cgroup/memory/memory.limit_in_bytes 2>/dev/null)
        if [ "$CGROUP_MEM" -lt 9223372036854771712 ] 2>/dev/null && [ -n "$CGROUP_MEM" ]; then
            SERVER_MEM=$((CGROUP_MEM / 1024 / 1024))
        fi
    fi
    if [ "$SERVER_MEM" -le 0 ] 2>/dev/null; then
        SERVER_MEM=$(free -m 2>/dev/null | awk '/^Mem:/{print $2}')
        SERVER_MEM=$((SERVER_MEM * 80 / 100))
    fi
    if [ "$SERVER_MEM" -le 0 ] 2>/dev/null || [ -z "$SERVER_MEM" ]; then
        SERVER_MEM=4096
    fi
    echo "Note: No memory limit set, detected ${SERVER_MEM}MB available"
fi
HEAP_SIZE=$((SERVER_MEM - MEMORY_OVERHEAD))
if [ $HEAP_SIZE -lt 1024 ]; then
    HEAP_SIZE=1024
fi

echo "Auth Domain: $AUTH_DOMAIN"
echo "Server Port: $HYTALE_PORT (UDP)"
if [ -n "$SERVER_PORT" ]; then
    echo "  (from Pterodactyl allocation)"
else
    echo "  (from HYTALE_PORT variable or default)"
fi
echo "Auth Mode: $AUTH_MODE"
echo "Memory: ${HEAP_SIZE}M"
echo ""

# Check required files
if [ ! -f "HytaleServer.jar" ]; then
    echo "ERROR: HytaleServer.jar not found!"
    echo "Run the installer again to download the server."
    exit 1
fi

if [ ! -f "Assets.zip" ]; then
    echo "ERROR: Assets.zip not found!"
    echo "Run the installer again to download the server files."
    exit 1
fi

# ========================================
# Fetch Server Tokens from Auth Server
# ========================================
echo "Fetching server tokens from F2P auth server..."

# Generate or load persistent server ID
if [ -f ".server-id" ]; then
    SERVER_ID=$(cat .server-id)
else
    SERVER_ID=$(cat /proc/sys/kernel/random/uuid 2>/dev/null || echo "server-$(hostname)-$(date +%s)")
    echo "$SERVER_ID" > .server-id
fi

echo "  Server ID: $SERVER_ID"
echo "  Server Name: $HYTALE_SERVER_NAME"

# F2P uses single endpoint without subdomains
AUTH_SERVER_URL="https://${AUTH_DOMAIN}"

# Call the auto-auth endpoint
RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST "${AUTH_SERVER_URL}/server/auto-auth" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d "{\"server_id\": \"${SERVER_ID}\", \"server_name\": \"${HYTALE_SERVER_NAME}\"}" \
  --connect-timeout 10 \
  --max-time 30 \
  2>/dev/null) || true

# Check if response contains tokens
if echo "$RESPONSE" | grep -q "sessionToken"; then
    # Extract tokens using sed (avoid jq dependency)
    SESSION_TOKEN=$(echo "$RESPONSE" | sed -n 's/.*"sessionToken"[[:space:]]*:[[:space:]]*"\([^"]*\)".*/\1/p')
    IDENTITY_TOKEN=$(echo "$RESPONSE" | sed -n 's/.*"identityToken"[[:space:]]*:[[:space:]]*"\([^"]*\)".*/\1/p')
    
    if [ -n "$SESSION_TOKEN" ] && [ -n "$IDENTITY_TOKEN" ]; then
        echo "  Session token: [obtained]"
        echo "  Identity token: [obtained]"
    else
        echo "WARNING: Could not extract tokens from response"
        SESSION_TOKEN=""
        IDENTITY_TOKEN=""
    fi
else
    echo "WARNING: Failed to fetch tokens from auth server"
    echo "  Response: $RESPONSE"
    echo "  Server will start without F2P tokens (official auth only)"
    SESSION_TOKEN=""
    IDENTITY_TOKEN=""
fi
echo ""

echo "Starting server..."
echo ""
echo "=========================================="
echo "  For official licensed clients, admin"
echo "  must run these commands in CONSOLE:"
echo "    /auth logout"
echo "    /auth persistence Encrypted"
echo "    /auth login device"
echo "=========================================="
echo ""

# Build Java command
JAVA_CMD="java -Xms${HEAP_SIZE}M -Xmx${HEAP_SIZE}M"

if [ -n "$JVM_ARGS" ]; then
    JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD $JVM_ARGS"
fi

JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD -jar HytaleServer.jar"
JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --assets Assets.zip"
JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --bind 0.0.0.0:${HYTALE_PORT}"
JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --auth-mode ${AUTH_MODE}"
JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --disable-sentry"

if [ -d "universe" ]; then
    JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --universe universe"
fi

if [ "${ENABLE_BACKUPS:-0}" = "1" ]; then
    JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --backup"
    if [ -n "$BACKUP_DIR" ]; then
        JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --backup-dir $BACKUP_DIR"
    fi
    if [ -n "$BACKUP_FREQUENCY" ]; then
        JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --backup-frequency $BACKUP_FREQUENCY"
    fi
fi

if [ "${ALLOW_OP:-0}" = "1" ]; then
    JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --allow-op"
fi

# Add server tokens if available (required for F2P auth grants)
if [ -n "$SESSION_TOKEN" ]; then
    JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --session-token $SESSION_TOKEN"
fi
if [ -n "$IDENTITY_TOKEN" ]; then
    JAVA_CMD="$JAVA_CMD --identity-token $IDENTITY_TOKEN"
fi

exec $JAVA_CMD
STARTSCRIPT

chmod +x start.sh
echo "Start script created."

# ========================================
# Step 1: Download from F2P Host
# ========================================
echo ""
echo "=== Step 1: F2P Server Download ==="
echo "Download URL: ${F2P_DOWNLOAD_BASE}"

# Download function with retry and progress on new lines
# Pterodactyl console doesn't support curl's carriage-return progress
# So we run curl in background and print progress on new lines
download_file() {
    local url="$1"
    local dest="$2"
    local name="$3"
    local expected_size_mb="$4"  # Expected size in MB for progress calc
    
    echo ""
    echo "Downloading ${name}..."
    if [ -n "$expected_size_mb" ]; then
        echo "Expected size: ~${expected_size_mb} MB"
    fi
    echo "URL: ${url}"
    echo ""
    
    for attempt in 1 2 3; do
        rm -f "${dest}.tmp"
        
        # Start curl in background (silent mode)
        curl -fL -s -o "${dest}.tmp" "${url}" &
        local curl_pid=$!
        
        # Monitor progress every 5 seconds
        local last_size=0
        local stall_count=0
        while kill -0 $curl_pid 2>/dev/null; do
            sleep 5
            if [ -f "${dest}.tmp" ]; then
                local current_size=$(stat -c%s "${dest}.tmp" 2>/dev/null || stat -f%z "${dest}.tmp" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
                local current_mb=$((current_size / 1024 / 1024))
                
                # Calculate speed (MB in last 5 seconds)
                local delta=$((current_size - last_size))
                local speed_mb=$((delta / 1024 / 1024 / 5))
                if [ $speed_mb -lt 1 ]; then
                    speed_mb=$((delta / 1024 / 5))  # KB/s
                    if [ -n "$expected_size_mb" ] && [ "$expected_size_mb" -gt 0 ]; then
                        local pct=$((current_mb * 100 / expected_size_mb))
                        echo "  Downloaded: ${current_mb} MB / ${expected_size_mb} MB (${pct}%) - ${speed_mb} KB/s"
                    else
                        echo "  Downloaded: ${current_mb} MB - ${speed_mb} KB/s"
                    fi
                else
                    if [ -n "$expected_size_mb" ] && [ "$expected_size_mb" -gt 0 ]; then
                        local pct=$((current_mb * 100 / expected_size_mb))
                        echo "  Downloaded: ${current_mb} MB / ${expected_size_mb} MB (${pct}%) - ${speed_mb} MB/s"
                    else
                        echo "  Downloaded: ${current_mb} MB - ${speed_mb} MB/s"
                    fi
                fi
                
                # Check for stall
                if [ "$current_size" -eq "$last_size" ]; then
                    stall_count=$((stall_count + 1))
                    if [ $stall_count -ge 12 ]; then  # 60 seconds of no progress
                        echo "  WARNING: Download appears stalled"
                    fi
                else
                    stall_count=0
                fi
                last_size=$current_size
            fi
        done
        
        # Check if curl succeeded
        wait $curl_pid
        local curl_exit=$?
        
        if [ $curl_exit -eq 0 ] && [ -f "${dest}.tmp" ]; then
            local final_size=$(stat -c%s "${dest}.tmp" 2>/dev/null || stat -f%z "${dest}.tmp" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
            local final_mb=$((final_size / 1024 / 1024))
            echo ""
            echo "${name} downloaded successfully (${final_mb} MB)"
            mv "${dest}.tmp" "${dest}"
            return 0
        fi
        
        echo ""
        echo "Attempt ${attempt} failed (exit code: ${curl_exit}), retrying in 3 seconds..."
        rm -f "${dest}.tmp"
        sleep 3
    done
    echo "ERROR: Failed to download ${name} after 3 attempts"
    return 1
}

# Download HytaleServer.jar
if [ -f "HytaleServer.jar" ] && [ "${FORCE_DOWNLOAD:-0}" != "1" ]; then
    local_size=$(stat -c%s "HytaleServer.jar" 2>/dev/null || stat -f%z "HytaleServer.jar" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    local_mb=$((local_size / 1024 / 1024))
    echo "HytaleServer.jar already exists (${local_mb} MB), skipping download."
    echo "Set FORCE_DOWNLOAD=1 to re-download."
else
    if ! download_file "${F2P_DOWNLOAD_BASE}/HytaleServer.jar" "HytaleServer.jar" "HytaleServer.jar" "80"; then
        echo "ERROR: Failed to download HytaleServer.jar"
        exit 1
    fi
fi

# Download Assets.zip
if [ -f "Assets.zip" ] && [ "${FORCE_DOWNLOAD:-0}" != "1" ]; then
    local_size=$(stat -c%s "Assets.zip" 2>/dev/null || stat -f%z "Assets.zip" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    local_mb=$((local_size / 1024 / 1024))
    echo "Assets.zip already exists (${local_mb} MB), skipping download."
    echo "Set FORCE_DOWNLOAD=1 to re-download."
else
    echo ""
    echo "============================================"
    echo "Downloading Assets.zip (~3.3 GB)"
    echo "This will take several minutes depending on"
    echo "your connection speed. Please be patient."
    echo "============================================"
    if ! download_file "${F2P_DOWNLOAD_BASE}/Assets.zip" "Assets.zip" "Assets.zip" "3300"; then
        echo "ERROR: Failed to download Assets.zip"
        exit 1
    fi
fi

# Verify files
echo ""
echo "Verifying downloaded files..."
if [ ! -f "HytaleServer.jar" ]; then
    echo "ERROR: HytaleServer.jar not found!"
    exit 1
fi

if [ ! -f "Assets.zip" ]; then
    echo "ERROR: Assets.zip not found!"
    exit 1
fi

jar_size=$(stat -c%s "HytaleServer.jar" 2>/dev/null || stat -f%z "HytaleServer.jar" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
assets_size=$(stat -c%s "Assets.zip" 2>/dev/null || stat -f%z "Assets.zip" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
jar_mb=$((jar_size / 1024 / 1024))
assets_mb=$((assets_size / 1024 / 1024))

echo "  HytaleServer.jar: ${jar_mb} MB"
echo "  Assets.zip: ${assets_mb} MB"
echo "Server files verified."

# ========================================
# Step 2: Setup Patcher
# ========================================
echo ""
echo "=== Step 2: Setting up DualAuthPatcher ==="

mkdir -p patcher/lib

echo "Downloading ASM libraries..."
curl -sL "https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/ow2/asm/asm/${ASM_VERSION}/asm-${ASM_VERSION}.jar" -o patcher/lib/asm-${ASM_VERSION}.jar
curl -sL "https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/ow2/asm/asm-tree/${ASM_VERSION}/asm-tree-${ASM_VERSION}.jar" -o patcher/lib/asm-tree-${ASM_VERSION}.jar
curl -sL "https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/ow2/asm/asm-util/${ASM_VERSION}/asm-util-${ASM_VERSION}.jar" -o patcher/lib/asm-util-${ASM_VERSION}.jar

echo "Downloading DualAuthPatcher..."
curl -sL "${PATCHER_URL}" -o patcher/DualAuthPatcher.java

echo "Compiling patcher..."
javac -cp "patcher/lib/asm-${ASM_VERSION}.jar:patcher/lib/asm-tree-${ASM_VERSION}.jar:patcher/lib/asm-util-${ASM_VERSION}.jar" -d patcher patcher/DualAuthPatcher.java

echo "Patcher ready."

# ========================================
# Step 3: Patch Server for Dual Auth
# ========================================
echo ""
echo "=== Step 3: Patching for Dual Authentication ==="

is_jar_patched() {
    if unzip -l HytaleServer.jar 2>/dev/null | grep -q "$INJECTED_CLASS"; then
        return 0
    fi
    return 1
}

if is_jar_patched; then
    echo "JAR already contains dual auth classes"
    echo "patched=true" > .patched_dual_auth
    echo "date=$(date -Iseconds 2>/dev/null || date)" >> .patched_dual_auth
    echo "domain=${AUTH_DOMAIN}" >> .patched_dual_auth
    echo "Server already patched, skipping"
else
    if [ -f ".patched_dual_auth" ]; then
        echo "WARNING: Flag file exists but JAR is not patched"
        rm -f .patched_dual_auth
    fi
    
    if [ -f "HytaleServer.jar.original" ]; then
        CURRENT_SIZE=$(stat -c%s HytaleServer.jar 2>/dev/null || stat -f%z HytaleServer.jar 2>/dev/null)
        BACKUP_SIZE=$(stat -c%s HytaleServer.jar.original 2>/dev/null || stat -f%z HytaleServer.jar.original 2>/dev/null)
        if [ "$CURRENT_SIZE" != "$BACKUP_SIZE" ]; then
            TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)
            mv HytaleServer.jar.original "HytaleServer.jar.original.${TIMESTAMP}"
            cp HytaleServer.jar HytaleServer.jar.original
        fi
    else
        cp HytaleServer.jar HytaleServer.jar.original
        echo "Backup created: HytaleServer.jar.original"
    fi
    
    echo "Patching server JAR..."
    CLASSPATH="patcher/lib/asm-${ASM_VERSION}.jar:patcher/lib/asm-tree-${ASM_VERSION}.jar:patcher/lib/asm-util-${ASM_VERSION}.jar:patcher"
    java -cp "${CLASSPATH}" DualAuthPatcher HytaleServer.jar
    
    if is_jar_patched; then
        echo "Patch verification: SUCCESS"
        echo "patched=true" > .patched_dual_auth
        echo "date=$(date -Iseconds 2>/dev/null || date)" >> .patched_dual_auth
        echo "domain=${AUTH_DOMAIN}" >> .patched_dual_auth
        echo "Server patched successfully!"
    else
        echo "ERROR: Patch verification FAILED"
        exit 1
    fi
fi

# ========================================
# Done
# ========================================
echo ""
echo "========================================"
echo "=== Installation Complete ==="
echo "========================================"
echo ""
echo "Server configured for DUAL AUTHENTICATION:"
echo "  - F2P clients: Connect directly"
echo "  - Official clients (${AUTH_DOMAIN}): Run IN-GAME:"
echo "      /auth logout"
echo "      /auth persistence Encrypted"
echo "      /auth login device"
echo "    Then complete Hytale auth (game license required)"
echo ""
echo "On each server start, tokens will be fetched from:"
echo "  https://${AUTH_DOMAIN}/server/auto-auth"
echo ""
echo "Files:"
ls -lh *.jar *.zip 2>/dev/null || true
echo ""

variables.name: F2P Download Base URL
variables.description: Base URL for downloading server files. Default: https://download.sanasol.ws/download

variables.name: Auth Domain
variables.description: F2P authentication server domain. Default: auth.sanasol.ws (4-16 chars)

variables.name: Server Port
variables.description: UDP port for the game server.

variables.name: Memory Overhead
variables.description: Memory reserved for JVM overhead in MB (subtracted from allocation).

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description: Display name for your server (used for token registration).

variables.name: Force Download
variables.description: Set to 1 to force re-download of server files even if they exist.

variables.name: Backup Directory
variables.description: Directory for backups (relative to server root).

variables.name: Allow Self Operator
variables.description: Allow players to use /op command to give themselves operator permissions.
